instruction: Create a table with the planets of the solar system and their dimensions
output:
Here is a table with the planets of the solar system and their dimensions:

| Planet | Diameter (km) | Equatorial Circumference (km) | Surface Area (km²) | Volume (km³) |
|--------|---------------|------------------------------|--------------------|--------------|
| Mercury | 4,879 | 15,329 | 74,822,000 | 6.083 × 10¹⁰ |
| Venus | 12,104 | 35,885 | 185,800,000 | 9.082 × 10¹⁰ |
| Earth | 12,742 | 40,075 | 510,065,000 | 1.083 × 10¹² |
| Mars | 6,792 | 21,745 | 144,798,000 | 1.632 × 10¹¹ |
| Jupiter | 142,984 | 439,800 | 614,200,000 | 1.431 × 10¹⁵ |
| Saturn | 120,536 | 438,100 | 1,083,200,000 | 8.27 × 10¹⁴ |
| Uranus | 51,118 | 157,800 | 8,130,000,000 | 6.99 × 10¹³ |
| Neptune | 49,528 | 155,300 | 10,170,000,000 | 1.33 × 10¹⁴ |
| Pluto | 2,374 | 7,956 | 10,230,000,000 | 6.06 × 10¹³ |

Note: The dimensions of Pluto are included for reference, but it is no longer considered a planet by the International Astronomical Union.
